page.title: 12Health
page.content: There is one hospital in the area called Netherlea and it is for old people. Any emergencies go to D.R.I. or to Ninewells in Dundee, where there are proper facilities. There is a hospital in Kirkcaldy but it is too far away. If somebody is ill they go to the doctor's surgery in Newport, where they receive treatment. If they don't get better they go to Dundee for specialised treatment. Newport on Tay is very good for health and has a very good record. The health in our area is controlled by three health visitors and five General Practioners. The health visitors hold baby clinics at Wormit twice a month on Mondays and one every Friday at Newport in the Blyth Hall.
